title: Mixed-use development in D.C.'s 14th Street corridor to include 233 apartments
text:
The new development, known as Collection 14, is anticipated to be completed in early 2021. Madison Investment plans to preserve a brick garage as the central focal point for the project as well as build new structures. There will be 25,000 square feet of retail space, 5,300 square feet of office space and 4,000 square feet of arts-focused event space, as well as the apartments.

78 apartments to rise on D.C.'s 14th Street

The apartments will have open floor plans, modern fixtures and stone counters. Some will have balconies. The apartment house is amid 14th Street’s shops, restaurants and nightlife. Planned building amenities include a fitness center, a dog-washing station, an electric car charging station and a Vespa parking section. Common spaces for residents will include a rooftop deck, indoor and outdoor entertainment areas, fire pits and grills. The residential entrance will be on W Street.

Kings Collective has been commissioned to create a large-scale mural along the alley of the building.

Madison Investment partnered with Atalaya Capital Management, Criterion and Bank OZK to finance this major redevelopment project and selected Design Army to assist with plans for the common spaces in the residential section, as well as graphics and marketing for the entire project.

For future updates, visit www.MadisonInvestments.net.
